com.developmentontheedge.beans.editors

Class CustomEditorSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.beans.PropertyEditorSupport
      • com.developmentontheedge.beans.editors.CustomEditorSupport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyEditorEx, ActionListener, PropertyEditor, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanEditor, ColorEditor, DimensionEditor, FontEditor, GenericComboBoxEditor, GenericMultiSelectEditor, HtmlEditor, IntegerEditor, RowHeaderRenderer, StringEditor, StringTagEditor, TextButtonEditor

    public class CustomEditorSupport
extends PropertyEditorSupport
implements PropertyEditorEx, ActionListener
    This is a support class to help build custom property editor.

    Child classes should add this class as FocusListener and as ActionListener (if possible) to JComponent used as editor.

      • getCustomRenderer

        public Component getCustomRenderer(Component parent,
                                   boolean isSelected,
                                   boolean hasFocus)
        Description copied from interface: PropertyEditorEx
        This method returns a Component that renders value of the property. Component is used for drawing only and will never obtain focus. Use PropertyEditor.getValue() method to get current property value.
        Specified by:
        getCustomRenderer in interface PropertyEditorEx
        Parameters:
        parent - the Component representing Property Inspector that has requested a editor
        isSelected - true if the cell is to be highlighted
        hasFocus - true if the cell has focus.
        Returns:
        rendered Component

      • supportsCustomEditor

        public boolean supportsCustomEditor()
        Determines whether this property editor supports a custom editor.
        Specified by:
        supportsCustomEditor in interface PropertyEditor
        Overrides:
        supportsCustomEditor in class PropertyEditorSupport
        Returns:
        true

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(JComponent component,
                            boolean isSelected,
                            Component parent)
        This method helps to make color of main editor or renederer component. Use this method in getCustomEditor(java.awt.Component, boolean) and getCustomRenderer(java.awt.Component, boolean, boolean) methods
        Parameters:
        component - the Component representing editor or renderer.
        isSelected - is component selected.
        parent - the Component representing PropertyInspector that is asking the renderer or editor to draw.
